conclusion: A uniform electric field exists in a cylindrical region with circular cross-section of radius R
A charged particle (mass m, charge q > 0) enters at point A
The particle's velocity is perpendicular to the electric field
A particle entering with zero initial velocity exits at point C with speed v₀
Angle between AC and AB is θ = 60°
Only electric force acts on the particle
Electric field E must be along the negative y-direction: E = -E₀ĵ
Acceleration of the particle due to the electric field is a = -(qE₀/m)ĵ
Position of the particle is r(t) = (-R, -(qE₀/m)t²/2)
Time when the particle reaches point C is t² = R·√3·m/(qE₀)
Velocity at point C is v(t₁) = -√(qE₀·R·√3/m)·ĵ
Speed at point C is v₀, so √(qE₀·R·√3/m) = v₀
Magnitude of the electric field strength is E₀ = (m·v₀²)/(q·R·√3)
